pullRequest.body:
Since `Real.sign` etc are being deprecated in favour of the generic `SignType.sign`, this PR adds some more API for the latter: in particular, compatibility of the canonical maps in and out of `SignType` with maps satisfying suitable assumptions. This is a prerequisite for #10011.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

I think this should be marked as a `norm_cast` lemma.
This should be called `map_cast`, and I guess the above can be renamed similarly.

OK, will do. There are also a bunch of pre-existing lemmas about `SignType.cast` with names like `coe_one`, should these become `cast_one` etc? (I am not sure if there is supposed to be a distinction between casting and coercion, or whether one is just the mathlib4 equivalent of the other.)

```suggestion
    [FunLike F Î± Î²] [ZeroHomClass F Î± Î²] {f : F} (hf : StrictMono f) (a : Î±) :
```
for clarity
